name: May Mobility
headline: Transforming cities and rural areas through AV transit and technology
description: May Mobility is a leader in autonomous vehicle technology development and deployment. With more than 300,000 autonomous rides to date, May Mobility is committed to delivering safe, efficient and sustainable shuttle solutions designed to complement today‚Äôs public transportation options. The company‚Äôs ultimate goal is to realize a world where self-driving systems make transportation more accessible and reliable, the roads safer, and encourage better land use in order to foster more green, vibrant, and livable spaces.

founders.name: Edwin Olson, Founder/CEO
founders.description:
Edwin Olson is the co-founder and CEO of May Mobility, Inc., an Ann Arbor-based startup that develops self-driving shuttles.  Olson earned his PhD from MIT in 2008 for work in robot mapping.  

Olson has worked on autonomous vehicles for over a decade, including work on the 2007 DARPA Urban Challenge and vehicles for Ford and Toyota Research Institute. Most recently, he was named "Entrepreneur of the Year" in the Michigan and Northwest Ohio region by EOY Awards.

#  The AV company _imagining every possibility_
From rural Minnesota to downtown Detroit and Atlanta‚Äôs suburbs, May Mobility is making safe, reliable autonomous rides a reality today.
  1. [Our Technology](http://maymobility.com/<https:/maymobility.com/technology/>)


![](http://maymobility.com)
## We're redefining the future of _autonomous driving_.
The cornerstone of our technology lies in our Multi-Policy Decision Making (MPDM) system, which is a major advancement over other AVs in the industry.
MPDM is real-time, reinforcement-learning AI algorithm that isn't limited by training data collected ahead of time. Our vehicles generate training examples relevant to their current environment and learn while driving‚Äîevery 200 milliseconds! This technology amplifies our system‚Äôs ability to learn and react to new situations and driving scenarios over the traditional approaches used by other companies.
![](http://maymobility.com)
## We're redefining the future of _autonomous driving_.
The cornerstone of our technology lies in our Multi-Policy Decision Making (MPDM) system, which is a major advancement over other AVs in the industry.
MPDM is real-time, reinforcement-learning AI algorithm that isn't limited by training data collected ahead of time. Our vehicles generate training examples relevant to their current environment and learn while driving‚Äîevery 200 milliseconds! This technology amplifies our system‚Äôs ability to learn and react to new situations and driving scenarios over the traditional approaches used by other companies.
![](http://maymobility.com)
## MPDM lets our vehicles learn _on the fly_ , just like a human driver.
Our technology solves the biggest problem in autonomous driving: safely handling the unexpected. These endless real-time, on-board simulations allow every vehicle to choose the most applicable next step and drive safely in each and every situation, no matter how unique it may be.
With MPDM, providers can safely deploy AVs at a fraction of the cost and time, bringing more reliable, safe, and efficient autonomous transportation to more people, faster.
  1. [Learn More](http://maymobility.com/<https:/maymobility.com/technology/>)


![](http://maymobility.com)
## MPDM lets our vehicles learn _on the fly_ , just like a human driver.
Our technology solves the biggest problem in autonomous driving: safely handling the unexpected. These endless real-time, on-board simulations allow every vehicle to choose the most applicable next step and drive safely in each and every situation, no matter how unique it may be.
With MPDM, providers can safely deploy AVs at a fraction of the cost and time, bringing more reliable, safe, and efficient autonomous transportation to more people, faster.
  1. [Learn More](http://maymobility.com/<https:/maymobility.com/technology/>)

### Our Commitment to Safety
Riders and other road users‚Äô safety is our top priority. Our combined sensor stack and unique Multi-Policy Decision Making platform work together to monitor the road and run simulations on possible situations and hazards far more reliably than rules-based systems. The result is a vehicle that reacts quickly with safe, predictable vehicle movements, which in turn ensures the safety of our riders‚Äîand everyone on the roadway. 
Learn More
[](http://maymobility.com/<https:/maymobility.com/technology/safety/>)
### Our Commitment to Accessibility
We‚Äôre passionate about providing equitable and accessible transportation to everyone. Using an ADA-compliant wheelchair ramp, our wheelchair-accessible Toyota Siennas can accommodate two riders in addition to a rider using a wheelchair. They can also accommodate service animals and an attendant. 
Learn More
[](http://maymobility.com/<https:/maymobility.com/technology/accessibility/>)
![](http://maymobility.com)
## Bring May Mobility To Your Community
We love meeting transit agencies, cities, campuses, organizations and businesses where they are to explore how our AV solutions can solve their transportation gaps for good. Ready to partner up? Let‚Äôs talk. 
  1. [Contact Us](http://maymobility.com/<https:/maymobility.com/contact/>)

#  The AV company _imagining every possibility_
From rural Minnesota to downtown Detroit and Atlanta‚Äôs suburbs, May Mobility is making safe, reliable autonomous rides a reality today.
  1. Our Technology‚ü®3‚ü©


![](http://maymobility.com)
## We're redefining the future of _autonomous driving_.
The cornerstone of our technology lies in our Multi-Policy Decision Making (MPDM) system, which is a major advancement over other AVs in the industry.
MPDM is real-time, reinforcement-learning AI algorithm that isn't limited by training data collected ahead of time. Our vehicles generate training examples relevant to their current environment and learn while driving‚Äîevery 200 milliseconds! This technology amplifies our system‚Äôs ability to learn and react to new situations and driving scenarios over the traditional approaches used by other companies.

### Our Commitment to Safety
Riders and other road users‚Äô safety is our top priority. Our combined sensor stack and unique Multi-Policy Decision Making platform work together to monitor the road and run simulations on possible situations and hazards far more reliably than rules-based systems. The result is a vehicle that reacts quickly with safe, predictable vehicle movements, which in turn ensures the safety of our riders‚Äîand everyone on the roadway. 
Learn More
[](http://maymobility.com/<https:/maymobility.com/technology/safety/>)
### Our Commitment to Accessibility
We‚Äôre passionate about providing equitable and accessible transportation to everyone. Using an ADA-compliant wheelchair ramp, our wheelchair-accessible Toyota Siennas can accommodate two riders in addition to a rider using a wheelchair. They can also accommodate service animals and an attendant. 
Learn More
[](http://maymobility.com/<https:/maymobility.com/technology/accessibility/>)

generated_description:
### May Mobility: Pioneering the Future of Autonomous Transit

**Overview**
Founded in 2017 and based in Ann Arbor, Michigan, May Mobility is a trailblazer in the field of autonomous vehicle (AV) technology. As part of Y Combinator's S17 cohort, it brings fresh innovation to the urban and rural transport sectors, aiming to transform mobility options worldwide.

**Mission**
May Mobility's mission is simple yet impactful: to transform cities and rural areas through autonomous vehicle transit and technology. The company seeks to enhance transportation accessibility, reliability, and sustainability, while fostering safer, greener, and more livable spaces for everyone.

**Achievements**
With an impressive record of over 300,000 autonomous rides, May Mobility emphasizes safety and efficiency in its shuttle solutions, which are designed to complement existing public transport systems. Its flagship technology, the Multi-Policy Decision Making (MPDM) system, utilizes real-time reinforcement learning to adapt constantly, making it a leader in the AV industry.

**Team and Culture**
The company boasts a dedicated team of around 260 employees who are passionate about rethinking transportation. They understand that successful AV deployment requires collaboration with various stakeholders, including cities, transit agencies, and local organizations. May Mobility values inclusivity, offering ADA-compliant services to ensure accessibility for all.

**Cutting-Edge Technology**
The MPDM system allows May Mobility's vehicles to learn on the fly‚Äîadjusting to new scenarios every 200 milliseconds. This adaptability is crucial for safely navigating complex environments. By continuously generating training scenarios relevant to their current surroundings, the vehicles enhance their decision-making capabilities without being limited by pre-collected data.

**Recent Developments**
In recent news, May Mobility has launched its first driverless commercial ride-hail service, marking a significant milestone in its operational expansion. Recognized for its innovative approach, the company is positioning itself against established players like Waymo by introducing self-driving vehicles that cater to broader transport needs.

**Future Directions**
As May Mobility continues to grow, it is keen on partnering with communities to identify and fill transportation gaps. The company is eager to expand its services, including the introduction of an autonomous minibus expected to debut in 2026, which reflects its commitment to innovative public transit solutions.

In essence, May Mobility is not just another tech startup; it embodies a vision for the future of transportation‚Äîone where cities are smarter, greener, and where getting around is as easy as hailing a ride. You can learn more about their vision and technology at [May Mobility's website](http://maymobility.com).
